intro: Gerardia mettaueri var. nuda, commonly known as the naked gerardia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the arid conditions of its native habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
